data.title: Alps Electric Co., Ltd. completed the acquisition of the remaining 59.57% stake in Alpine Electronics, Inc. from Elliott Management Corporation and Oasis Management Company Ltd.
data.meta_description: Alps Electric Co., Ltd.  executed a share exchange agreement to acquire the remaining 59.57% stake in Alpine Electronics, Inc.  from Elliott Management Corporation and Oasis Management Company Ltd....
data.text:
Alps Electric Co., Ltd. (TSE:6770) executed a share exchange agreement to acquire the remaining 59.57% stake in Alpine Electronics, Inc. (TSE:6816) from Elliott Management Corporation and Oasis Management Company Ltd. for ¥90.2 billion on July 27, 2017. Alps Electric Co., Ltd. will acquire 7.3% and 9.9% stake from Elliott Management Corporation and Oasis Management Company Ltd. respectively. As consideration, 0.68 shares of the Alps Electric will be issued for each share of the Alpine Electronics. Alps Electric holds 28.22 million shares, representing 40.43% stake in Alpine Electronics. After completion, Alpine Electronics will become a wholly owned subsidiary of Alps Electric and Alps Electric will carry out an absorption-type company split pursuant to which it will succeed all of its business to a newly established wholly owned subsidiary, ALPS HD CO., LTD. The execution of the absorption-type company split agreement is postponed. Alps Electric Co., Ltd.'s Board has decided to cancel the Absorption-type Company Split, change the management structure following the Business Integration from a pure holding company structure to an operating holding company structure, and introduce an in-house company system. Alps Electric Co., Ltd.'s has resolved, at its Board of Directors meeting held today, to partially change the Amendments to the Articles of Incorporation to the effect that the Amendments to the Articles of Incorporation will be effected on the condition that the share exchange will have taken effect and its company name will be changed to ALPS ALPINE CO., LTD. after the Amendments to the Articles of Incorporation take effect. In connection with the transaction, the shares of Alpine are scheduled to be delisted from the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange on December 26, 2018. Alpine Electronics, Inc. common shares are scheduled to be delisted from the First Section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange as of December 26, 2018. The number of Directors of Alps Electric Co., Ltd. (which is to be renamed ALPS ALPINE CO., LTD. on the Reorganization Date) on the reorganization date will be 11, including Toshihiro Kuriyama.

The transaction is subject to the approval of the extraordinary general meeting of shareholders of Alpine scheduled to be held on December 5, 2018 and without approval of the general meeting of shareholders of Alps Electric. The transaction was unanimously approved by the Board of Apine Electronics and approved by the Board of Alps Electric on July 27, 2017. FTC gave an early termination notice for the transaction on February 2, 2018. Alps Electric and Alpine resolved at their respective board of directors meetings held on February 27, 2018 to change the management structure following the business integration from a pure holding company structure to an operating holding company structure and introduce an in-house company system, and Alps Electric and Alpine executed a memorandum of understanding to amend the share exchange agreement to implement the changes that are necessary in connection with the structure change. As of May 25, 2018, European Commission has approved the transaction. As on December 5, 2018, the transaction has been approved by the shareholders of Alpine Electronics, Inc. The Board of Directors of Alpine Electronics established a third-party committee consisting of three members, namely Hideo Kojima, Shunsuke Teragaki, and Toshikazu Nakazawa, for taking the opinion in respect of the transaction. The share exchange is scheduled to take effect on January 1, 2019.

Nomura Securities Co., Ltd. acted as a financial advisor and fairness opinion provider and Mori Hamada & Matsumoto LPC acted as a legal advisor to Alps Electric Co., Ltd. SMBC Nikko Securities Inc. acted as a financial advisor and fairness opinion provider and TMI Associates acted as a legal advisor to Alpine Electronics, Inc. Dan Underwood of Ashton Consulting acted as PR advisor in the transaction. Masahisa Ikeda, Toshiro M. Mochizuki, Yuki Shirato, Ami Kurakado and Brandon Whittaker of Shearman & Sterling LLP acted as legal advisor to Alps Electric Co., Ltd. and Alpine Electronics, Inc. YAMADA Consulting Group Co., Ltd acted as fairness opinion provider to Alpine. SMBC Nikko Securities Inc. will be paid an advisory fee of ¥440 million.

Alps Electric Co., Ltd. (TSE:6770) completed the acquisition of the remaining 59.57% stake in Alpine Electronics, Inc. (TSE:6816) from Elliott Management Corporation and Oasis Management Company Ltd. on January 1, 2019. Alpine Electronics got delisted on December 26, 2018.
